App description:
Inspired by Adam Savages Tested One Day Builds, Adam Savages Tested VR takes audiences on a journey inside the creative workspaces of incredible makers, bringing their processes to life, from ideation to creation. Featuring an eclectic roster of creators including a Broadway and TV puppeteer and a cosplay animatronic wings designer, Adam and the Tested team put viewers inside their workshops for an intimate look at their builds.
 
Adam Savages Tested VR features 8 episodes filmed with 180-degree stereoscopic cameras that allow for an immersive look at the creative process like never before. Bonus footage includes Adam's "Cave" workshop tours.
 
Makers include:
- Adam Savage, Maker/TV Personality
- Brett Foxwell, Machinist/Stop-Motion Animator
- Rick Lyon, Puppeteer & Puppet Designer
- Melissa Ng, Gothic Armor Designer
- Andrew Freeman, Creature Mask Sculptor
- Griffon Ramsey, Chainsaw Wood Sculptor
- Alexis Noriega, Costume Wing Designer
- Ryan Nagata, Spacesuit Replica Fabricator

BertHalfpintFeb 21 at 1:51 AM
Time for some new content?


I think this is fundamentally a different experience from watching traditional video ,as I guess the field of view and " depth" perception of VR is far more immersive ? I see myself here as an audience member in a TV studio rather than just sat on my sofa with my TV 15 feet away.

The clarity of each experience is superb and the feeling of being in the room is quite compelling. I think " passive" VR is just as acceptable as full on " rapid teleporting mass combat" . I personally can not find the stamina to run around dead-heading zombies 24/7 ( fun as this is ).

This is quite different from watching traditional TV , yes / no?

I do agree that the current crop of videos could have been experienced in YouTube VR if the video quality was obtainable there?
My only reason for dropping a  is the wait for new content. I guess I believed it would be like a TV show with new episodes uploaded regularly. Or ..... is this it ? Then
maybe have to drop more s ?

Perhaps other developers or TV studios will pick up from here and create a true VR show.

This is very good as a concept and the host presenter in the workshop is a delight and each video segment is delivered with care, attention to detail and good humour .

And..... I have to have me a full set of Demon Wings .

Great dip into Adams world

I've been following tested for a while and i love that they're always trying me things and this is a great first foray into vr for them!

I love the hub, great to see a cardboard represention of adams shop and fun to play with the bits and bobs there. Although disappointing i couldn't move far from the table, dying to look around properly. Wish there were more things to play with and more easter eggs.

The content itself is also great, the static 180 video i think it's a good choice. One thing i thought when i first started watching is although I'm interested in what Adam is talking about, this experience feels like I'm actually in his shop, i was desperate to get a tour as though i was a guest there, to get shown all the tools and other nick nacks i can see around me. I found myself just looking around at all the fun stuff rather than listening what he's actually taking about.

Another thing is having to download the videos rather than being able to stream them. I realise this is a technical thing and the videos are huge but it feels like a step back the age of streaming. Great stuff though can't wait for more!!

Helpful | 4

DK_VRSep 12, 2019 at 9:44 AM
A fantastic experience for everyone

I love Tested and I've loved Adam Savage since the Mythbuster days. This app is fantastic. The presentation is excellent and the video quality is some of the best 3d Stereo out right now. Period. I've always wanted to see Adam's shop in VR. I was just talking to someone about watching an Untitled podcast episode or a one day buil in VR and this comes out of nowhere. It's above and beyond what I wanted. There's so much to see. His shop is the perfect place for 3D video. There's so much to see and so many layers to his stuff that it gives off some of the best depth and I swear my eyes were playing tricks. I could sense the parallax in some shots.

The video files are really large, however, they download in a few minutes. It's all very impressive.

This should be in everyone's library even if you don't know what tested is. This is a glimpse into the future of how we can get involved in our favorite creator's lives. We can be there with them, work along side them. It's an intimacy like never before. It's exciting stuff.

starship42Nov 10 at 12:52 PM
Visually disappointing, but interesting.

I have to confess I was a little underwhelmed and disappointed by the "VR" in this title which otherwise was interesting subject matter I'm sure for many. The VR pov for the observer is stationary, so if you try to look down or side to side the entire picture and everything in it shifts with you in each of the individual episodes. So you have to keep your head still and just watch as if you are watching in 2D. There was alot of wide angle distortion as well if you didn't look straight ahead, which in my view defeated the purpose of recording in a real workshop that you really couldn't look around in. The content was informative. The video format used not enjoyable imo.

Very well done.

Subject matter wasn't always that interesting to me but the variety of topics piqued my interest on couple things.

Quality is pretty great. Apart from nearly poking my eye out with that sword ;] lighting, variety of the set, the closeups where pretty nice but I wish were 3d but i understand the choice made.

The only thing i will complain is the framerate. For far away stuff 30fps is ok-ish. But for close up stuff it's simply too low. I know now the cameras could handle more which was discussed in VR version of the podcast.

weirdmonkey2807Sep 16, 2019 at 9:46 PM
Really love the idea and content

The issue with the videos is that they are technically flawed and presented at a very low frame rate. There is also quite a lot of stereoscopic misalignment which over a longer period of time is quite difficult to watch. Given the scope of this production I do not understand why this wasnt fixed in post before release. Dont look up, down, left or right, or it will break the illusion (180 only) and cause a headache. This is best enjoyed by sitting back in a chair and just looking straight which makes the whole experience just a slight bit better than watching a regular video but with a lot of weight attached to your head. I watched the first episode and my neck was already starting to hurt pretty badly. I dont think the hardware is ready yet for these longer videos to be consumed - at least not yet. Overall given that its free, its a no brainer!

TheMightyJYSep 13, 2019 at 10:53 AM
Great collection of 180VR content

I really like Tested's video content and being able to watch builds in VR was a very cool experience. Not only do you get an episode in Adam Savage's "cave", they explore the spaces of many other makers. The two I've seen so far have been fantastic.

tofuninja5489Sep 14, 2019 at 10:26 PM
Completely thought out VR content

Although I haven't gotten to finish all the videos, I've been having a great time watching AND learning from all the various makers the Tested team has brought in. It's not just a half baked 180 video, the creators of this content have thought of everything to make the videos so much more engaging to learn. For instance, there's a lot of 'picture in picture' style pop up videos that get close up when a vr camera would not work. Or during Lumecluster's segment where they project the 3D model of the armor on the screen IN 3D as the person wearing said armor is walking around. That's something you can't do in any other medium right now and the fact that they have implemented it so well makes this a great watching experience. If you love watching makers make, this is your current deep dive into that world in VR
